penalty clause.translation[0].definition: the part of a contract which says what someone will have to pay or do if they do not obey the agreement, for example if they do not complete work on time
penalty clause.translation[1].definition: a condition in a contract that says what will happen if one of the people or organizations involved does not do what the contract states they should
The defendants were liable to a penalty clause in the main contract if the work was not completed on time.
